task.title: Save to a Different Type of Drawing File
task.shortdesc: Choose the format from Files Type in the Save Drawing As dialog box, you can save a drawing to an earlier version of the drawing format (DWG) or drawing interchange format (DXF), or save a drawing as a template file.

context.p: You can save a drawing with a new name and in any of the following file formats:

ul.li: Standard drawing files with a ".dwg" extension. You can choose a DWG file format that is compatible with various versions of AutoCAD.
Drawing Exchange Format files with a ".dxf" file extension. You can choose a DXF file format that is compatible with various versions of AutoCAD.
Drawing templates with a ".dwt" file extension. Drawing templates allow you to easily create new drawings that reuse your drawing settings and entities.

context.p: To save a drawing with a new name or file format

step.cmd: Choose File > Save As from the main menu.
In the Save Drawing As dialog box, under Files of Type, choose the file format.
Specify the name of the file you want to create.

result.p: TIP You can also export drawing files to various file formats.
